00043   int DAMGCreateSuppressedDOFs(DAMG* damg) {
00044     int       nlevels = damg[0]->nlevels; //number of multigrid levels
00045     unsigned int dof = damg[0]->dof;
00046     for(int i = 0; i < nlevels; i++) {
00047       unsigned int sz = (dof*(damg[i]->da->getLocalBufferSize()));
00048       if(sz) {
00049         damg[i]->suppressedDOF = new unsigned char[sz];
00050         assert(damg[i]->suppressedDOF);
00051       }
00052 
00053       if(damg[i]->da_aux) {
00054         unsigned int sz2 = (dof*(damg[i]->da_aux->getLocalBufferSize()));
00055         if(sz2) {
00056           damg[i]->suppressedDOFaux = new unsigned char[sz2];
00057           assert(damg[i]->suppressedDOFaux);
00058         }
00059       }
00060     }
00061     return 1;
00062   }

00064   PetscErrorCode DAMG_Initialize(MPI_Comm comm) {
00065     PROF_MG_INIT_BEGIN 
00066 
00067       ot::DA_Initialize(comm);
00068 
00069 #ifdef __USE_MG_INIT_TYPE3__
00070     ot::DAMG_InitPrivateType3(comm);
00071 #else
00072 #ifdef __USE_MG_INIT_TYPE2__
00073     ot::DAMG_InitPrivateType2(comm);
00074 #else
00075     ot::DAMG_InitPrivateType1(comm);
00076 #endif
00077 #endif
00078 
00079     PROF_MG_INIT_END  
00080   }

00093   void DAMG_InitPrivateType2(MPI_Comm comm) {
00094 
00095     int rank, npes;
00096     MPI_Comm_rank(comm, &rank);
00097     MPI_Comm_size(comm, &npes);
00098 
00099     const int THOUSAND = 1000;
00100     int numGroups = (npes/THOUSAND);
00101     if( (numGroups*THOUSAND) < npes) {
00102       numGroups++;
00103     }
00104 
00105     MPI_Comm newComm;
00106 
00107     bool* isEmptyList = new bool[npes];
00108     assert(isEmptyList);
00109     for(int i = 0; i < numGroups; i++) {
00110       for(int j = 0; (j < (i*THOUSAND)) && (j < npes); j++) {
00111         isEmptyList[j] = true;
00112       }
00113       for(int j = (i*THOUSAND); (j < ((i+1)*THOUSAND)) && (j < npes); j++) {
00114         isEmptyList[j] = false;
00115       }
00116       for(int j = ((i + 1)*THOUSAND); j < npes; j++) {
00117         isEmptyList[j] = true;
00118       }
00119       MPI_Comm tmpComm;
00120       par::splitComm2way(isEmptyList, &tmpComm, comm);
00121       if(!(isEmptyList[rank])) {
00122         newComm = tmpComm;
00123       }
00124     }//end for i
00125     delete [] isEmptyList;
00126

00567               tmpVtxMaps[ctr] = VtxMap1[i][j][k][l]; 
00568               ctr++;
00569             }//end for l
00570           }//end for k
00571         }//end for j
00572       }//end for i
00573       for(int i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
00574         for(int j = 0; j < 8; j++) {
00575           for(int k = 0; k < 8; k++) {
00576             for(int l = 0; l < 18; l++) {
00577               for(int m = 0; m < 8; m++) {
00578                 tmpVtxMaps[ctr] = VtxMap2[i][j][k][l][m]; 
00579                 ctr++;
00580               }//end for m
00581             }//end for l
00582           }//end for k
00583         }//end for j
00584       }//end for i
00585       for(int i = 0; i < 7; i++) {
00586         for(int j = 0; j < 2; j++) {
00587           for(int k = 0; k < 8; k++) {
00588             for(int l = 0; l < 18; l++) {
00589               for(int m = 0; m < 8; m++) {
00590                 tmpVtxMaps[ctr] = VtxMap3[i][j][k][l][m]; 
00591                 ctr++;
00592               }//end for m
00593             }//end for l
00594           }//end for k
00595         }//end for j
00596       }//end for i
00597       for(int i = 0; i < 7; i++) {
00598         for(int j = 0; j < 2; j++) {
00599           for(int k = 0; k < 8; k++) {
00600             for(int l = 0; l < 8; l++) {
00601               for(int m = 0; m < 18; m++) {
00602                 for(int n = 0; n < 8; n++) {
00603                   tmpVtxMaps[ctr] = VtxMap4[i][j][k][l][m][n]; 
00604                   ctr++;
00605                 }//end for n
00606               }//end for m
00607             }//end for l
00608           }//end for k
00609         }//end for j
00610       }//end for i
00611     }
00612 
00613     par::Mpi_Bcast<unsigned short>(tmpVtxMaps, 228096, 0, comm);
00614 
00615     if(rank) {
00616       unsigned int ctr = 0;
00617       for(int i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
00618         for(int j = 0; j < 8; j++) {
00619           for(int k = 0; k < 18; k++) {
00620             for(int l = 0; l < 8; l++) {
00621               VtxMap1[i][j][k][l] = tmpVtxMaps[ctr]; 
00622               ctr++;
00623             }//end for l
00624           }//end for k
00625         }//end for j
00626       }//end for i
00627       for(int i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
00628         for(int j = 0; j < 8; j++) {
00629           for(int k = 0; k < 8; k++) {
00630             for(int l = 0; l < 18; l++) {
00631               for(int m = 0; m < 8; m++) {
00632                 VtxMap2[i][j][k][l][m] = tmpVtxMaps[ctr]; 
00633                 ctr++;
00634               }//end for m
00635             }//end for l
00636           }//end for k
00637         }//end for j
00638       }//end for i
00639       for(int i = 0; i < 7; i++) {
00640         for(int j = 0; j < 2; j++) {
00641           for(int k = 0; k < 8; k++) {
00642             for(int l = 0; l < 18; l++) {
00643               for(int m = 0; m < 8; m++) {
00644                 VtxMap3[i][j][k][l][m] = tmpVtxMaps[ctr]; 
00645                 ctr++;
00646               }//end for m
00647             }//end for l
00648           }//end for k
00649         }//end for j
00650       }//end for i
00651       for(int i = 0; i < 7; i++) {
00652         for(int j = 0; j < 2; j++) {
00653           for(int k = 0; k < 8; k++) {
00654             for(int l = 0; l < 8; l++) {
00655               for(int m = 0; m < 18; m++) {
00656                 for(int n = 0; n < 8; n++) {
00657                   VtxMap4[i][j][k][l][m][n] = tmpVtxMaps[ctr]; 
00658                   ctr++;
00659                 }//end for n
00660               }//end for m
00661             }//end for l
00662           }//end for k
00663         }//end for j
00664       }//end for i
00665     }
00666 
00667     delete [] tmpVtxMaps;
00668 
00669   }
00670 
00671   PetscErrorCode DAMG_Finalize() {
00672     PROF_MG_FINAL_BEGIN
00673 
00674       ot::DA_Finalize();
00675 
00676     destroyRmatType1Stencil(RmatType1Stencil);
00677     destroyRmatType2Stencil(RmatType2Stencil);
00678     destroyVtxMaps(VtxMap1, VtxMap2, VtxMap3, VtxMap4);
00679 
00680     PROF_MG_FINAL_END  
00681   }
00682 
00683   PetscErrorCode DAMGDestroy(DAMG* damg)
00684   {
00685     PetscErrorCode ierr;
00686     int       i,nlevels = damg[0]->nlevels;
00687 
00688     PetscFunctionBegin;
00689 
00690     int rank;
00691     MPI_Comm_rank(damg[0]->comm,&rank);
00692 
00693     if (!damg) SETERRQ(PETSC_ERR_ARG_NULL,"Passing null as DAMG");
00694 
00695     for (i = 1; i < nlevels; i++) {
00696       if (damg[i]->R) {
00697         ierr = MatDestroy(damg[i]->R);
00698         CHKERRQ(ierr);
00699       }
00700     }
00701 
00702     for (i = 0; i < nlevels; i++) {
00703       if (damg[i]->x)       {
00704         ierr = VecDestroy(damg[i]->x);
00705         CHKERRQ(ierr);
00706       }
00707 
00708       if (damg[i]->b)       {
00709         ierr = VecDestroy(damg[i]->b);
00710         CHKERRQ(ierr);
00711       }
00712 
00713       if (damg[i]->r)       {
00714         ierr = VecDestroy(damg[i]->r);
00715         CHKERRQ(ierr);
00716       }
00717 
00718       if(damg[i]->suppressedDOF) {
00719         delete [] (damg[i]->suppressedDOF);
00720         damg[i]->suppressedDOF = NULL;
00721       }
00722 
00723       if(damg[i]->suppressedDOFaux) {
00724         delete [] (damg[i]->suppressedDOFaux);
00725         damg[i]->suppressedDOFaux = NULL;
00726       }
00727 
00728       if (damg[i]->B && (damg[i]->B != damg[i]->J)) {
00729         ierr = MatDestroy(damg[i]->B);CHKERRQ(ierr);
00730       }
00731 
00732       if (damg[i]->J)         {
00733         ierr = MatDestroy(damg[i]->J);CHKERRQ(ierr);
00734       }
00735 
00736       if (damg[i]->ksp) {
00737         ierr = KSPDestroy(damg[i]->ksp);CHKERRQ(ierr);
00738       }
00739 
00740       if (damg[i]->da)      {
00741         delete damg[i]->da; 
00742         damg[i]->da = NULL;
00743       }
00744 
00745       if (damg[i]->da_aux)      {
00746         delete damg[i]->da_aux; 
00747         damg[i]->da_aux = NULL;
00748       }
00749 
00750       delete damg[i];
00751       damg[i] = NULL;
00752     }//end for all levels
00753 
00754     delete [] damg;
00755     damg = NULL;  
00756     PetscFunctionReturn(0);
00757   }
00758 
00759   //RS: This is the function used to create the J matrix. 
00760   //This must be called before calling DAMGSetKSP or DAMGSetSNES if you want to set
00761   //J and B to be different. If this is not called, by default J and B will be equal.
00762   PetscErrorCode DAMGCreateJMatrix(DAMG damg, PetscErrorCode (*crjac)(DAMG,Mat*)) {
00763     PetscErrorCode ierr;
00764     PetscFunctionBegin;         
00765     if(crjac){
00766       ierr = (*crjac)(damg,&(damg->J)); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00767     }else{
00768       SETERRQ(PETSC_ERR_ARG_NULL,"ot::DA can not create a Matrix for you! Pass a function handle.");  
00769     }
00770     PetscFunctionReturn(0);
00771   }
00772 
00773   //crjac is the function to create the B matrix for each level
00774   //compJac is an optional function to change the entries of the matrix. This
00775   //could be used if you don't want to re-build the matrix but only want to
00776   //change its entries. It is not useful for a single stand-alone solve.
00777   PetscErrorCode DAMGSetKSP(DAMG *damg, PetscErrorCode (*crjac)(DAMG,Mat*), 
00778       PetscErrorCode (*compJac)(DAMG,Mat,Mat), PetscErrorCode (*rhs)(DAMG,Vec) )        
00779   {
00780     PetscErrorCode ierr;
00781     int  nlevels = damg[0]->nlevels;
00782 
00783     //Galerkin coarsening is NOT an option.
00784     PROF_MG_SET_KSP_BEGIN
00785 
00786       int rank;
00787     MPI_Comm_rank(damg[0]->comm, &rank);
00788 
00789     if (!damg) SETERRQ(PETSC_ERR_ARG_NULL,"Passing null as DAMG");  
00790     if (!crjac) SETERRQ(PETSC_ERR_ARG_NULL,"ot::DA can not create a Matrix for you! Pass a function handle.");
00791 
00792     if (!damg[0]->ksp) {
00793       /* create solvers for each level if they don't already exist*/
00794       for (int i = 0; i < nlevels; i++) {
00795         if (!damg[i]->B) {              
00796           ierr = (*crjac)(damg[i],&(damg[i]->B));CHKERRQ(ierr);
00797         }
00798         if (!damg[i]->J) {
00799 #ifdef __DEBUG_MG__
00800           if(!rank) {   
00801             std::cout<<"J and B are the same for lev: "<<i<<std::endl;
00802             fflush(stdout);
00803           }
00804 #endif
00805           damg[i]->J = damg[i]->B;
00806         }else {
00807 #ifdef __DEBUG_MG__
00808           if(!rank) {   
00809             std::cout<<"J and B are different for lev: "<<i<<std::endl;
00810             fflush(stdout);
00811           }
00812 #endif
00813           assert(damg[i]->J != damg[i]->B);
00814         }
00815 
00816         ierr = KSPCreate(damg[i]->comm,&(damg[i]->ksp));CHKERRQ(ierr);
00817 
00818         //No prefix for the finest level
00819         if(i < (nlevels-1)) {
00820           char prefix[256];
00821           sprintf(prefix,"damg_levels_%d_",(int)i);
00822           KSPSetOptionsPrefix(damg[i]->ksp,prefix);
00823         }
00824 
00825         ierr = DAMGSetUpLevel(damg,damg[i]->ksp,i+1); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00826 
00827         ierr = KSPSetFromOptions(damg[i]->ksp);CHKERRQ(ierr);
00828 
00829         if( (damg[0]->da->getNpesActive()) < (damg[0]->da->getNpesAll()) ) {
00830           //If all processors are NOT active on the coarsest grid
00831           //reset the solver on the coarsest grid to be KSP_Shell 
00832           PC pc;
00833           const char* clearOptionPrefix;
00834           char optionName[256];
00835           if(i == 0) {
00836             KSPGetOptionsPrefix(damg[0]->ksp, &clearOptionPrefix);
00837 
00838             sprintf(optionName, "-%sksp_type",clearOptionPrefix);
00839             ierr = PetscOptionsClearValue(optionName); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00840             ierr = KSPSetType(damg[0]->ksp, KSPRICHARDSON); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00841 
00842             sprintf(optionName, "-%sksp_knoll",clearOptionPrefix);
00843             ierr = PetscOptionsClearValue(optionName); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00844             ierr = KSPSetInitialGuessKnoll(damg[0]->ksp, PETSC_FALSE);
00845             CHKERRQ(ierr);
00846 
00847             sprintf(optionName, "-%sksp_richardson_scale",clearOptionPrefix);
00848             ierr = PetscOptionsClearValue(optionName); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00849             ierr = KSPRichardsonSetScale(damg[0]->ksp, 1.0);
00850             CHKERRQ(ierr);
00851 
00852             sprintf(optionName, "-%sksp_right_pc",clearOptionPrefix);
00853             ierr = PetscOptionsClearValue(optionName); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00854             sprintf(optionName, "-%sksp_symmetric_pc",clearOptionPrefix);
00855             ierr = PetscOptionsClearValue(optionName); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00856             ierr = KSPSetPreconditionerSide(damg[0]->ksp, PC_LEFT);
00857             CHKERRQ(ierr);
00858 
00859             sprintf(optionName, "-%sksp_norm_type",clearOptionPrefix);
00860             ierr = PetscOptionsClearValue(optionName); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00861             ierr = KSPSetNormType(damg[0]->ksp, KSP_NORM_NO);
00862             CHKERRQ(ierr);
00863 
00864             sprintf(optionName, "-%sksp_rtol",clearOptionPrefix);
00865             ierr = PetscOptionsClearValue(optionName); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00866             sprintf(optionName, "-%sksp_atol",clearOptionPrefix);
00867             ierr = PetscOptionsClearValue(optionName); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00868             sprintf(optionName, "-%sksp_divtol",clearOptionPrefix);
00869             ierr = PetscOptionsClearValue(optionName); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00870             sprintf(optionName, "-%sksp_max_it",clearOptionPrefix);
00871             ierr = PetscOptionsClearValue(optionName); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00872             ierr = KSPSetTolerances(damg[0]->ksp, PETSC_DEFAULT, PETSC_DEFAULT,
00873                 PETSC_DEFAULT, 1); 
00874             CHKERRQ(ierr);
00875 
00876             ierr = KSPSetConvergenceTest(damg[0]->ksp, KSPSkipConverged,
00877                 PETSC_NULL,PETSC_NULL);
00878             CHKERRQ(ierr);
00879 
00880             ierr = KSPSetInitialGuessNonzero(damg[0]->ksp, PETSC_FALSE);
00881             CHKERRQ(ierr);
00882 
00883             ierr  = KSPGetPC(damg[0]->ksp, &pc); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00884 
00885             PCGetOptionsPrefix(pc, &clearOptionPrefix);
00886             sprintf(optionName, "-%spc_type",clearOptionPrefix);
00887             ierr = PetscOptionsClearValue(optionName); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00888             ierr  = PCSetType(pc, PCSHELL); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00889             ierr = PCShellSetName(pc, "PC_KSP_Shell"); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00890 
00891             PC_KSP_Shell* pcShellContext = new PC_KSP_Shell;
00892             assert(pcShellContext);
00893             pcShellContext->sol_private = NULL;
00894             pcShellContext->rhs_private = NULL;
00895             pcShellContext->ksp_private = NULL;
00896             pcShellContext->pc = pc;
00897             pcShellContext->iAmActive = damg[0]->da->iAmActive();
00898             pcShellContext->commActive = damg[0]->da->getCommActive();
00899             ierr = PCShellSetContext(pc, pcShellContext); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00900             ierr = PCShellSetSetUp(pc, PC_KSP_Shell_SetUp); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00901             ierr = PCShellSetApply(pc, PC_KSP_Shell_Apply); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00902             ierr = PCShellSetDestroy(pc, PC_KSP_Shell_Destroy); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00903           } else {
00904             ierr  = KSPGetPC(damg[i]->ksp, &pc); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00905           }
00906 
00907           PetscTruth ismg;
00908           PetscTypeCompare((PetscObject)pc, PCMG, &ismg);
00909 
00910           if(ismg) {
00911             PetscTruth useRTLMG;
00912             ierr = PetscOptionsHasName(PETSC_NULL,"-damg_useRTLMG",&useRTLMG);
00913             CHKERRQ(ierr);
00914             KSP lksp;
00915             if(useRTLMG) {
00916               while(ismg) {
00917                 ierr = PCMGGetSmoother(pc,0,&lksp);CHKERRQ(ierr);
00918                 ierr  = KSPGetPC(lksp, &pc); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00919                 PetscTypeCompare((PetscObject)pc, PCMG, &ismg);
00920               }
00921             } else {
00922               ierr = PCMGGetSmoother(pc,0,&lksp);CHKERRQ(ierr);
00923             }
00924 
00925             KSPGetOptionsPrefix(lksp, &clearOptionPrefix);
00926 
00927             sprintf(optionName, "-%sksp_type",clearOptionPrefix);
00928             ierr = PetscOptionsClearValue(optionName); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00929             ierr = KSPSetType(lksp, KSPRICHARDSON); CHKERRQ(ierr);              
00930 
00931             sprintf(optionName, "-%sksp_knoll",clearOptionPrefix);
00932             ierr = PetscOptionsClearValue(optionName); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00933             ierr = KSPSetInitialGuessKnoll(lksp, PETSC_FALSE);
00934             CHKERRQ(ierr);
00935 
00936             sprintf(optionName, "-%sksp_richardson_scale",clearOptionPrefix);
00937             ierr = PetscOptionsClearValue(optionName); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00938             ierr = KSPRichardsonSetScale(lksp, 1.0);
00939             CHKERRQ(ierr);
00940 
00941             sprintf(optionName, "-%sksp_right_pc",clearOptionPrefix);
00942             ierr = PetscOptionsClearValue(optionName); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00943             sprintf(optionName, "-%sksp_symmetric_pc",clearOptionPrefix);
00944             ierr = PetscOptionsClearValue(optionName); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00945             ierr = KSPSetPreconditionerSide(lksp, PC_LEFT);
00946             CHKERRQ(ierr);
00947 
00948             sprintf(optionName, "-%sksp_norm_type",clearOptionPrefix);
00949             ierr = PetscOptionsClearValue(optionName); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00950             ierr = KSPSetNormType(lksp, KSP_NORM_NO);
00951             CHKERRQ(ierr);
00952 
00953             sprintf(optionName, "-%sksp_rtol",clearOptionPrefix);
00954             ierr = PetscOptionsClearValue(optionName); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00955             sprintf(optionName, "-%sksp_atol",clearOptionPrefix);
00956             ierr = PetscOptionsClearValue(optionName); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00957             sprintf(optionName, "-%sksp_divtol",clearOptionPrefix);
00958             ierr = PetscOptionsClearValue(optionName); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00959             sprintf(optionName, "-%sksp_max_it",clearOptionPrefix);
00960             ierr = PetscOptionsClearValue(optionName); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00961             ierr = KSPSetTolerances(lksp, PETSC_DEFAULT, PETSC_DEFAULT,
00962                 PETSC_DEFAULT, 1); 
00963             CHKERRQ(ierr);
00964 
00965             ierr = KSPSetConvergenceTest(lksp, KSPSkipConverged, PETSC_NULL, PETSC_NULL);
00966             CHKERRQ(ierr);
00967 
00968             ierr = KSPSetInitialGuessNonzero(lksp, PETSC_FALSE);
00969             CHKERRQ(ierr);
00970 
00971             ierr  = KSPGetPC(lksp, &pc); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00972 
00973             PCGetOptionsPrefix(pc, &clearOptionPrefix);
00974             sprintf(optionName, "-%spc_type",clearOptionPrefix);
00975             ierr = PetscOptionsClearValue(optionName); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00976             ierr  = PCSetType(pc, PCSHELL); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00977             ierr = PCShellSetName(pc, "PC_KSP_Shell"); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00978 
00979             PC_KSP_Shell* pcShellContext = new PC_KSP_Shell;
00980             assert(pcShellContext);
00981             pcShellContext->sol_private = NULL;
00982             pcShellContext->rhs_private = NULL;
00983             pcShellContext->ksp_private = NULL;
00984             pcShellContext->pc = pc;
00985             pcShellContext->iAmActive = damg[0]->da->iAmActive();
00986             pcShellContext->commActive = damg[0]->da->getCommActive();
00987             ierr = PCShellSetContext(pc, pcShellContext); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00988             ierr = PCShellSetSetUp(pc, PC_KSP_Shell_SetUp); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00989             ierr = PCShellSetApply(pc, PC_KSP_Shell_Apply); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00990             ierr = PCShellSetDestroy(pc, PC_KSP_Shell_Destroy); CHKERRQ(ierr);
00991           }//end if PC==MG
00992         }//end if all procs active on coarsest level
00993 
00994         damg[i]->solve = DAMGSolveKSP;
00995         damg[i]->rhs   = rhs;
00996       }//end for i
00997     }//end if ksp
00998 
00999 #ifdef __DEBUG_MG__
01000     MPI_Barrier(damg[0]->comm);
01001     if(!rank) {
01002       std::cout<<"Finished setting up ksp for all levels."<<std::endl;
01003       fflush(stdout);
01004     }
01005     MPI_Barrier(damg[0]->comm);
01006 #endif
01007 
01008     //Evaluate Matrix at each level
01009     for (int i = 0; i < nlevels; i++) {
01010       if(compJac) {
01011         ierr = (*compJac)(damg[i],damg[i]->J,damg[i]->B); CHKERRQ(ierr);
01012       }
01013     }
01014 
01015     //Set operators at each level.   
01016     for(int level = 0; level < nlevels; level++) {
01017       KSPSetOperators(damg[level]->ksp, damg[level]->J,
01018           damg[level]->B, SAME_NONZERO_PATTERN);
01019 
01020       PC pc;
01021       KSPGetPC(damg[level]->ksp, &pc);
01022 
01023       PetscTruth ismg;
01024       PetscTypeCompare((PetscObject)pc, PCMG, &ismg);
01025 
01026       if(ismg) {
01027         for(int i = 0; i <= level; i++) {
01028           KSP lksp;
01029           PCMGGetSmoother(pc, i, &lksp);
01030           KSPSetOperators(lksp, damg[i]->J, damg[i]->B, SAME_NONZERO_PATTERN);
01031         }//end for i
01032       }
01033     }//end for level
01034 
01035 #ifdef __DEBUG_MG__
01036     MPI_Barrier(damg[0]->comm);
01037     if(!rank) {
01038       std::cout<<"Finished building matrices for all levels."<<std::endl;
01039       fflush(stdout);
01040     }
01041     MPI_Barrier(damg[0]->comm);
01042 #endif
01043 
01044     PROF_MG_SET_KSP_END
01045   }
01046 
01047   PetscErrorCode DAMGSetNullSpace(DAMG* damg, PetscTruth has_cnst, PetscInt n,
01048       PetscErrorCode (*func)(DAMG,Vec[]))
01049   {
01050     PetscErrorCode ierr;
01051     int       i, j, nlevels = damg[0]->nlevels;
01052     Vec            *nulls = 0;
01053     MatNullSpace   nullsp;
01054     KSP            iksp;
01055     PC             pc,ipc;
01056     PetscTruth     ismg,isred;
01057 
01058     PetscFunctionBegin;
01059     if (!damg) SETERRQ(PETSC_ERR_ARG_NULL,"Passing null as DAMG");
01060     if (!damg[0]->ksp) SETERRQ(PETSC_ERR_ORDER,"Must call AFTER DAMGSetKSP() or DAMGSetSNES()");
01061     if ((n && !func) || (!n && func)) SETERRQ(PETSC_ERR_ARG_INCOMP,"Both n and func() must be set together");
01062     if (n < 0) SETERRQ1(PETSC_ERR_ARG_OUTOFRANGE,"Cannot have negative number of vectors in null space n = %D",n)
01063 
01064       for (i = 0; i < nlevels; i++) {
01065         if (n) {
01066           ierr = VecDuplicateVecs(damg[i]->b,n,&nulls);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01067           ierr = (*func)(damg[i],nulls);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01068         }
01069         ierr = MatNullSpaceCreate(damg[i]->comm,has_cnst,n,nulls,&nullsp);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01070         ierr = KSPSetNullSpace(damg[i]->ksp,nullsp);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01071         for (j = i; j < nlevels; j++) {
01072           ierr = KSPGetPC(damg[j]->ksp,&pc);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01073           ierr = PetscTypeCompare((PetscObject)pc,PCMG,&ismg);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01074           if (ismg) {
01075             ierr = PCMGGetSmoother(pc,i,&iksp);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01076             ierr = KSPSetNullSpace(iksp, nullsp);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01077           }
01078         }
01079         ierr = MatNullSpaceDestroy(nullsp);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01080         if (n) {
01081           ierr = PetscFree(nulls);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01082         }
01083       }//end for i
01084 
01085     /* make all the coarse grid solvers have LU shift since they are singular */
01086     for (i = 0; i < nlevels; i++) {
01087       ierr = KSPGetPC(damg[i]->ksp,&pc);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01088       ierr = PetscTypeCompare((PetscObject)pc,PCMG,&ismg);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01089       if (ismg) {
01090         ierr = PCMGGetSmoother(pc,0,&iksp);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01091         ierr = KSPGetPC(iksp,&ipc);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01092         ierr = PetscTypeCompare((PetscObject)ipc,PCREDUNDANT,&isred);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01093         if (isred) {
01094           ierr = PCRedundantGetPC(ipc,&ipc);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01095         }
01096         ierr = PCFactorSetShiftPd(ipc,PETSC_TRUE);CHKERRQ(ierr); 
01097       }
01098     }//end for i
01099 
01100     PetscFunctionReturn(0);
01101   }
01102 
01103   PetscErrorCode DAMGSetInitialGuess(DAMG* damg, PetscErrorCode (*guess)(DAMG, Vec)) {
01104     int i, nlevels = damg[0]->nlevels;
01105     for(i = 0; i < nlevels; i++) {
01106       damg[i]->initialguess = guess;
01107     }
01108     return(0);
01109   }
01110 
01111   PetscErrorCode DAMGInitialGuessCurrent(DAMG damg, Vec vec) {
01112     return (0);
01113   }
01114 
01115   PetscErrorCode DAMGSolve(DAMG* damg)
01116   {
01117     PetscErrorCode ierr;
01118     int       i,nlevels = damg[0]->nlevels;
01119     PetscTruth     gridseq,vecmonitor;
01120 
01121     PetscFunctionBegin;
01122     ierr = PetscOptionsHasName(0,"-damg_grid_sequence",&gridseq);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01123     ierr = PetscOptionsHasName(0,"-damg_vecmonitor",&vecmonitor);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01124     if (gridseq) {    
01125       if(damg[0]->initialguess) {
01126         (*(damg[0]->initialguess))(damg[0],damg[0]->x);
01127         KSPSetInitialGuessNonzero(damg[0]->ksp, PETSC_TRUE);
01128       }
01129       for (i=0; i<nlevels-1; i++) {
01130         ierr = (*damg[i]->solve)(damg,i);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01131         if (vecmonitor) {
01132           ierr = VecView(damg[i]->x,PETSC_VIEWER_DRAW_(damg[i]->comm));CHKERRQ(ierr);
01133         }
01134         ierr = MatInterpolate(damg[i+1]->R,damg[i]->x,damg[i+1]->x);CHKERRQ(ierr);      
01135         KSPSetInitialGuessNonzero(damg[i+1]->ksp, PETSC_TRUE);
01136       }    
01137     }else {
01138       if(damg[nlevels-1]->initialguess) {
01139         (*(damg[nlevels-1]->initialguess))(damg[nlevels-1], damg[nlevels-1]->x);
01140         KSPSetInitialGuessNonzero(damg[nlevels-1]->ksp, PETSC_TRUE);
01141       }
01142     }
01143     ierr = (*DAMGGetFine(damg)->solve)(damg, nlevels-1);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01144     if (vecmonitor) {
01145       ierr = VecView(damg[nlevels-1]->x,PETSC_VIEWER_DRAW_(damg[nlevels-1]->comm));CHKERRQ(ierr);
01146     }  
01147     PetscFunctionReturn(0);
01148   }
01149 
01150   PetscErrorCode DAMGSolveKSP(DAMG *damg, int level)
01151   {
01152     PetscErrorCode ierr;
01153 
01154     PetscFunctionBegin;
01155 
01156     if (damg[level]->rhs) {
01157       ierr = (*damg[level]->rhs)(damg[level],damg[level]->b);CHKERRQ(ierr); 
01158     }
01159 
01160     ierr = KSPSolve(damg[level]->ksp, damg[level]->b, damg[level]->x);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01161 
01162     PetscFunctionReturn(0);
01163   }
01164 
01165   PetscErrorCode DAMGSetUpLevel(DAMG* damg, KSP ksp, int nlevels)
01166   {
01167     PetscErrorCode ierr;
01168     PC             pc;
01169     PetscTruth     ismg,monitor,ismf,isshell,ismffd;
01170     PetscTruth     useRTLMG;
01171     KSP            lksp; /* solver internal to the multigrid preconditioner */
01172     MPI_Comm       *comms,comm;
01173     PetscViewer    ascii;
01174 
01175     PetscFunctionBegin;
01176     if (!damg) SETERRQ(PETSC_ERR_ARG_NULL,"Passing null as DAMG");
01177 
01178     ierr = PetscOptionsHasName(PETSC_NULL,"-damg_ksp_monitor",&monitor);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01179     ierr = PetscOptionsHasName(PETSC_NULL,"-damg_useRTLMG",&useRTLMG);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01180 
01181     if (monitor) {
01182       ierr = PetscObjectGetComm((PetscObject)ksp,&comm);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01183       ierr = PetscViewerASCIIOpen(comm,"stdout",&ascii);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01184       ierr = PetscViewerASCIISetTab(ascii,1+(damg[0]->nlevels)-nlevels);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01185       ierr = KSPMonitorSet(ksp, KSPMonitorDefault, ascii,
01186           (PetscErrorCode(*)(void*))PetscViewerDestroy);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01187     }
01188 
01189     /* use fgmres on outer iteration by default */
01190     ierr  = KSPSetType(ksp, KSPFGMRES); CHKERRQ(ierr);
01191     ierr  = KSPGetPC(ksp,&pc); CHKERRQ(ierr);
01192     ierr  = PCSetType(pc,PCMG); CHKERRQ(ierr);
01193 
01194     const char *mainKSPprefix;
01195     KSPGetOptionsPrefix(ksp, &mainKSPprefix);
01196 
01197     if(useRTLMG) {
01198       char prefixName[256];
01199       sprintf(prefixName, "rtlmg_finest_");
01200       PCSetOptionsPrefix(pc, mainKSPprefix);
01201       PCAppendOptionsPrefix(pc, prefixName);
01202       //finest to coarsest
01203       for(int i = (nlevels-1); i >= 1; i--) {
01204         ierr  = PetscMalloc(2*sizeof(MPI_Comm),&comms);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01205         for (int j = 0; j < 2; j++) {
01206           comms[j] = damg[j]->comm;
01207         }
01208         PCMGSetLevels(pc,2,comms);
01209         PetscFree(comms);
01210         PCMGSetType(pc,PC_MG_FULL);
01211         PetscTypeCompare((PetscObject)pc,PCMG,&ismg);
01212         if (ismg) {
01213           /*Finer Level*/
01214           PCMGGetSmoother(pc,1,&lksp);
01215           KSPSetOperators(lksp,damg[i]->B,damg[i]->B,DIFFERENT_NONZERO_PATTERN);
01216           PCMGSetR(pc,1,damg[i]->r);
01217           PCMGSetResidual(pc,1,PCMGDefaultResidual,damg[i]->B);
01218           /*Coarser Level*/
01219           PCMGGetSmoother(pc,0,&lksp);
01220           KSPSetOperators(lksp,damg[i-1]->J,damg[i-1]->J,DIFFERENT_NONZERO_PATTERN);
01221           PCMGSetX(pc,0,damg[i-1]->x);
01222           PCMGSetRhs(pc,0,damg[i-1]->b);
01223           /* Set interpolation/restriction between levels */
01224           PCMGSetInterpolation(pc,1,damg[i]->R);
01225           PCMGSetRestriction(pc,1,damg[i]->R);
01226           if(i > 1) {
01227             /*Get PC for the next level*/
01228             KSPSetType(lksp,KSPFGMRES);
01229             KSPGetPC(lksp,&pc);
01230             PCSetType(pc,PCMG);
01231             sprintf(prefixName, "rtlmg_levels_%d_",((int)(i-1)));
01232             PCSetOptionsPrefix(pc, mainKSPprefix);
01233             PCAppendOptionsPrefix(pc, prefixName);
01234           }
01235         }//end if mg
01236       }//end for i
01237     } else {
01238       //Standard Scheme same as original DMMG 
01239       ierr  = PetscMalloc(nlevels*sizeof(MPI_Comm),&comms);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01240       for (int i = 0; i < nlevels; i++) {
01241         comms[i] = damg[i]->comm;
01242       }
01243       ierr  = PCMGSetLevels(pc,nlevels,comms);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01244       ierr =  PCMGSetType(pc,PC_MG_FULL);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01245 
01246       ierr  = PetscFree(comms);CHKERRQ(ierr); 
01247 
01248       ierr = PetscTypeCompare((PetscObject)pc,PCMG,&ismg);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01249       if (ismg) {
01250         /* set solvers for each level */
01251         for (int i = 0; i < nlevels; i++) {
01252           ierr = PCMGGetSmoother(pc, i, &lksp);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01253 
01254           ierr = KSPSetOperators(lksp, damg[i]->J, damg[i]->B,
01255               DIFFERENT_NONZERO_PATTERN);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01256 
01257           if (i < nlevels-1) { /* don't set for finest level, they are set in PCApply_MG()*/
01258             ierr = PCMGSetX(pc,i,damg[i]->x);CHKERRQ(ierr); 
01259             ierr = PCMGSetRhs(pc,i,damg[i]->b);CHKERRQ(ierr); 
01260           }
01261           if (i > 0) {
01262             ierr = PCMGSetR(pc,i,damg[i]->r);CHKERRQ(ierr); 
01263             ierr = PCMGSetResidual(pc,i,PCMGDefaultResidual,damg[i]->J);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01264           }
01265           if (monitor) {
01266             ierr = PetscObjectGetComm((PetscObject)lksp,&comm);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01267             ierr = PetscViewerASCIIOpen(comm,"stdout",&ascii);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01268             ierr = PetscViewerASCIISetTab(ascii,1+damg[0]->nlevels-i);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01269             ierr = KSPMonitorSet(lksp,KSPMonitorDefault,ascii,
01270                 (PetscErrorCode(*)(void*))PetscViewerDestroy);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01271           }
01272           /* If using a matrix free multiply and did not provide an explicit matrix to build
01273              the preconditioner then must use no preconditioner 
01274              */
01275           ierr = PetscTypeCompare((PetscObject)damg[i]->B,MATSHELL,&isshell);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01276           ierr = PetscTypeCompare((PetscObject)damg[i]->B,MATDAAD,&ismf);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01277           ierr = PetscTypeCompare((PetscObject)damg[i]->B,MATMFFD,&ismffd);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01278           if (isshell || ismf || ismffd) {
01279             PC  lpc;
01280             ierr = KSPGetPC(lksp,&lpc);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01281             //This is only the default value. It can be modified later
01282             ierr = PCSetType(lpc,PCNONE);CHKERRQ(ierr);
01283           }
01284         }//end for i
01285 
01286         /* Set interpolation/restriction between levels */
01287         for (int i=1; i<nlevels; i++) {
01288           ierr = PCMGSetInterpolation(pc,i,damg[i]->R);CHKERRQ(ierr); 
01289           ierr = PCMGSetRestriction(pc,i,damg[i]->R);CHKERRQ(ierr); 
01290         }//end for i
01291       }//end if mg
01292     }//end if TLMG
01293 
01294     PetscFunctionReturn(0);
01295   }//end fn.
01296 
01297   //level = 0 is the coarsest, level = (nlevels-1) is the finest.
01298   //nlevels for each level is the number of levels finer than this level.
01299   //New implementation. Written on April 24, 2008
01300   PetscErrorCode DAMGCreateAndSetDA(MPI_Comm comm, int & nlevels, 
01301       void* user, DAMG** damg, std::vector<ot::TreeNode>& finestOctree,
01302       unsigned int dof, double loadFac,
01303       bool compressLut, bool incCorner) {
01304 
01305     PROF_MG_SET_DA_BEGIN
01306 
01307       PROF_SET_DA_STAGE1_BEGIN
01308 
01309       PetscErrorCode ierr;
01310     int rank, npes;
01311     MPI_Comm_rank(comm, &rank);
01312     MPI_Comm_size(comm, &npes);
01313 
01314 #ifndef __SILENT_MODE__
01315     if(!rank) {
01316       std::cout<<"MG-Load Fac: "<<loadFac<<std::endl;
01317       fflush(stdout);
01318     }
01319 #endif
01320 
01321     par::partitionW<ot::TreeNode>(finestOctree, NULL, comm);
01322 
01323     assert(nlevels > 0);
01324     if(finestOctree.empty()) {
01325       std::cout<<"Processor "<<rank<<
01326         " called DAMGCreateAndSetDA with an empty finest octree."<<std::endl;
01327       fflush(stdout);
01328       assert(false);
01329     }
01330 
01331     unsigned int dim = finestOctree[0].getDim();
01332     unsigned int maxDepth = finestOctree[0].getMaxDepth();
01333 
01334     PROF_SET_DA_STAGE1_END
01335 #ifdef __PROF_WITH_BARRIER__
01336       MPI_Barrier(comm);
01337 #endif
01338     PROF_SET_DA_STAGE2_BEGIN
01339 
01340       int idxOfCoarsestLev = -1; 
01341 
01342     std::vector<ot::TreeNode>* coarserOctrees = NULL;
01343 
01344     bool* activeStatesInCoarseBal = NULL;
01345     MPI_Comm* activeCommsInCoarseBal = NULL;
01346     int* activeNpesInCoarseBal = NULL;
01347 
01348     if(nlevels > 1) {
01349       coarserOctrees = new std::vector<ot::TreeNode> [nlevels-1];
01350       assert(coarserOctrees);
01351 
01352       activeStatesInCoarseBal = new bool[nlevels - 1];
01353       assert(activeStatesInCoarseBal);
01354 
01355       activeCommsInCoarseBal = new MPI_Comm[nlevels - 1];
01356       assert(activeCommsInCoarseBal);
01357 
01358       activeNpesInCoarseBal = new int[nlevels - 1];
01359       assert(activeNpesInCoarseBal);
01360 
01361       //Default value is false so if a processor becomes inactive at some
01362       //level and exits the loop it will still have the correct value for the
01363       //remaining levels 
01364       for(int i = 0; i < (nlevels-1); i++) {
01365         activeStatesInCoarseBal[i] = false;
01366       }//end for i
01367 
01368       MPI_Comm tmpComm1 = comm;
01369       MPI_Comm tmpComm2;
01370       bool iAmActiveForCoarsening = true;
01371       bool repeatLoop = true;
01372       while( (idxOfCoarsestLev < (nlevels-2)) && (repeatLoop) ) {
01373         std::vector<ot::TreeNode> tmpOctree;      
01374         //First coarsen
01375         if (idxOfCoarsestLev == -1) {
01376           //We can skip Partition for the first call to coarsen since
01377           //finestOctree is explicitly partitioned above. 
01378           ot::coarsenOctree(finestOctree, tmpOctree, dim, maxDepth, 
01379               tmpComm1, true, &tmpComm2, &iAmActiveForCoarsening);
01380         } else {
01381           //We cannot skip Partition here since there is no explicit call to
01382           //partition at the end of balancing and after the intial block
01383           //partition, balancing could have introduced a load imbalance across
01384           //the processors
01385           ot::coarsenOctree(coarserOctrees[idxOfCoarsestLev], tmpOctree,
01386               dim, maxDepth, tmpComm1, false, &tmpComm2, &iAmActiveForCoarsening);
01387         }//end if finest level
01388 
01389         idxOfCoarsestLev++;
01390 
01391         //Then balance
01392         if(iAmActiveForCoarsening) {
01393           ot::balanceOctree(tmpOctree, coarserOctrees[idxOfCoarsestLev],
01394               dim, maxDepth, incCorner, tmpComm2, &tmpComm1, &iAmActiveForCoarsening);
01395         }
01396         tmpOctree.clear();
01397 
01398         //All active processors for this level will have the correct comm set
01399         //and that's all we care. We do not care about the comms for inactive
01400         //processors
01401         activeStatesInCoarseBal[idxOfCoarsestLev] = iAmActiveForCoarsening;
01402         activeCommsInCoarseBal[idxOfCoarsestLev] = tmpComm1;
01403 
01404         if(iAmActiveForCoarsening) {
01405           MPI_Comm_size(tmpComm1, (activeNpesInCoarseBal + idxOfCoarsestLev));
01406           if( (activeNpesInCoarseBal[idxOfCoarsestLev] == 1) &&
01407               (coarserOctrees[idxOfCoarsestLev].size() < 500) ) {
01408             repeatLoop = false;
01409           }
01410         } else {
01411           assert(coarserOctrees[idxOfCoarsestLev].empty());
01412           break;
01413         }
01414 
01415       }//end while
01416     }//end if initial nlevels > 1
01417 
01418     PROF_SET_DA_STAGE2_END
01419 #ifdef __PROF_WITH_BARRIER__
01420       MPI_Barrier(comm);
01421 #endif
01422     PROF_SET_DA_STAGE3_BEGIN
01423 
01424       //Only processor 0 is guaranteed to have the correct idxOfCoarsestLev
01425       par::Mpi_Bcast<int>(&idxOfCoarsestLev, 1, 0, comm);
01426 
01427     //Reset nlevels
01428     nlevels = (idxOfCoarsestLev + 2);
01429 
01430     //Need to synchronize activeNpesInCoarseBal across all processors.
01431     //Only processor 0 is guaranteed to be active at all levels. Hence, only it
01432     //will have the correct values at all levels. Inactive processors will have
01433     //junk values.  Similarly, only processor 0 will have the correct
01434     //globalSizes for all levels since only it is active on all levels.
01435     //Inactive processors will have junk values.
01436     if(nlevels > 1) {
01437       par::Mpi_Bcast<int>(activeNpesInCoarseBal, (nlevels - 1), 0, comm);
01438     }
01439 
01440 #ifdef __DEBUG_MG__
01441     char fname[256];
01442     for(int lev = 0; lev < (nlevels - 1); lev++) {
01443       sprintf(fname, "coarseOctBeforeBdy_%d_%d_%d.ot", lev, rank, npes);
01444       ot::writeNodesToFile(fname, coarserOctrees[lev]);
01445     }
01446     sprintf(fname, "finestOctBeforeBdy_%d_%d.ot", rank, npes);
01447     ot::writeNodesToFile(fname, finestOctree);
01448 #endif
01449 
01450 #ifdef __USE_PVT_DA_IN_MG__
01451     //All processors are active on the finest level
01452     std::vector<ot::TreeNode> positiveBoundaries;
01453     ot::addBoundaryNodesType1(finestOctree, positiveBoundaries, dim, maxDepth);
01454 
01455     //update maxdepth
01456     maxDepth = maxDepth + 1;
01457 
01458     //Most processors will not add any positive boundaries. So, there is no need
01459     //to unnecessarily distribute positive boundaries on all procs just for
01460     //sorting. So only the few processors touching the positive boundary will
01461     //participate in the parallel sort
01462     MPI_Comm bdyComm;
01463     par::splitComm2way((positiveBoundaries.empty()), &bdyComm, comm);
01464 
01465     if(!(positiveBoundaries.empty())) {
01466       //Call Sample Sort  
01467       std::vector<ot::TreeNode > tmpVecTN;
01468       par::sampleSort<ot::TreeNode>(positiveBoundaries, tmpVecTN, bdyComm);
01469       positiveBoundaries = tmpVecTN;
01470       tmpVecTN.clear();
01471     }
01472 
01473     par::concatenate<ot::TreeNode>(finestOctree, positiveBoundaries, comm);
01474     positiveBoundaries.clear();
01475 
01476     //Now for all the coarser levels
01477     for (int lev = 0; lev < (nlevels - 1); lev++) {
01478       if(activeStatesInCoarseBal[lev]) {        
01479         ot::addBoundaryNodesType1(coarserOctrees[lev], positiveBoundaries, dim, maxDepth-1);
01480 
01481         //Most processors will not add any positive boundaries. So, there is no need
01482         //to unnecessarily distribute positive boundaries on all procs just for
01483         //sorting. So only the few processors touching the positive boundary will
01484         //participate in the parallel sort
01485         par::splitComm2way((positiveBoundaries.empty()), &bdyComm, activeCommsInCoarseBal[lev]);
01486 
01487         if(!(positiveBoundaries.empty())) {
01488           //Call Sample Sort  
01489           std::vector<ot::TreeNode > tmpVecTN;
01490           par::sampleSort<ot::TreeNode>(positiveBoundaries, tmpVecTN, bdyComm);
01491           positiveBoundaries = tmpVecTN;
01492           tmpVecTN.clear();
01493         }
01494 
01495         par::concatenate<ot::TreeNode>(coarserOctrees[lev], positiveBoundaries, activeCommsInCoarseBal[lev]);
01496         positiveBoundaries.clear();
01497       }
01498     }//end for lev
01499 
01500 #endif
01501 
01502 #ifdef __DEBUG_MG__
01503     for(int lev = 0; lev < (nlevels - 1); lev++) {
01504       sprintf(fname, "coarseOctAfterBdy_%d_%d_%d.ot", lev, rank, npes);
01505       ot::writeNodesToFile(fname, coarserOctrees[lev]);
01506     }
01507     sprintf(fname, "finestOctAfterBdy_%d_%d.ot", rank, npes);
01508     ot::writeNodesToFile(fname, finestOctree);
01509 #endif
01510 
01511 
01512     //All processors should know the global size at each level
01513     DendroIntL* localOctreeSizeForThisLevel = new DendroIntL[nlevels];
01514     assert(localOctreeSizeForThisLevel);
01515 
01516     DendroIntL* globalOctreeSizeForThisLevel = new DendroIntL[nlevels];
01517     assert(globalOctreeSizeForThisLevel);
01518 
01519     localOctreeSizeForThisLevel[0] = finestOctree.size();
01520     for(int lev = 0; lev < (nlevels - 1); lev++) {
01521       localOctreeSizeForThisLevel[lev + 1] = coarserOctrees[lev].size();
01522     }//end for lev
01523     par::Mpi_Allreduce<DendroIntL>(localOctreeSizeForThisLevel,
01524         globalOctreeSizeForThisLevel, nlevels, MPI_SUM, comm);
01525     delete [] localOctreeSizeForThisLevel;
01526 
01527 #ifdef __DEBUG_MG__
01528     MPI_Barrier(comm);
01529     for(int i = 0; i < (nlevels - 1); i++) {
01530       if(rank < activeNpesInCoarseBal[i]) {
01531         assert(activeStatesInCoarseBal[i]);
01532       } else {
01533         assert(!(activeStatesInCoarseBal[i]));
01534       }
01535     }//end for i
01536     MPI_Barrier(comm);
01537 #endif
01538 
01539     //0 is the finest and (nlevels-1) is the coarsest
01540     int *maxProcsForThisLevel = new int [nlevels];
01541     assert(maxProcsForThisLevel);
01542 
01543     for(int i = 0; i < nlevels; i++) {
01544       const DendroIntL THOUSAND = 1000;
01545       if(globalOctreeSizeForThisLevel[i] < (THOUSAND*npes)) {
01546         int maxProcsToUse = (globalOctreeSizeForThisLevel[i]/THOUSAND);
01547         if(maxProcsToUse == 0) {
01548           maxProcsToUse = 1;
01549         }
01550         maxProcsForThisLevel[i] = maxProcsToUse;
01551       } else {
01552         //use all the processors
01553         maxProcsForThisLevel[i] = npes;
01554       }
01555     }//end for i
01556 
01557     //maxProcsForThisLevel was computed above using the final balanced octree
01558     //size for that level. However, the octree itself may be distributed on
01559     //(a) fewer or (b) more processors. The former case occurs when too many
01560     //new octants were generated during the balancing step. The latter case
01561     //occurs when too many extra boundaries were removed. Here we measure the
01562     //discrepancy between the two and decide which one to pick. On one hand if
01563     //we change the number of active processors, then we must call scatter to 
01564     //redistribute the octants. On the other hand if the grain size is much
01565     //larger than what it should be we will unnecessarily increase the cost
01566     //for subsequent operations. We will do this only for the coarsest level,
01567     //this will automatically influence the finer levels in the subsequent
01568     //step. 
01569     if(nlevels > 1) {
01570       if(activeNpesInCoarseBal[nlevels - 2] < maxProcsForThisLevel[nlevels - 1]) {
01571         DendroIntL currentGrainSize = 
01572           (globalOctreeSizeForThisLevel[nlevels - 1]/activeNpesInCoarseBal[nlevels - 2]);
01573 
01574         DendroIntL expectedGrainSize = 
01575           (globalOctreeSizeForThisLevel[nlevels - 1]/maxProcsForThisLevel[nlevels - 1]);
01576 
01577         if(static_cast<double>(currentGrainSize) < 
01578             (1.5*static_cast<double>(expectedGrainSize))) {
01579           maxProcsForThisLevel[nlevels - 1] = activeNpesInCoarseBal[nlevels - 2];
01580         }
01581       }
01582     }
01583 
01584     //avoid repartitioning at every level.
01585     //Loop from coarsest to finest
01586     //If the fine level does not fit on all processors, then
01587     //the coarser levels will not fit on all p either.
01588     //The procs for the coarse level will be >= 1/8 that
01589     //of the finer level and <= the finer level procs. This is because the
01590     //number of elements on the coarse level can be anything from almost same
01591     //(just 8 octants coarsened) to a 8 times reduction in size.  
01592     //So the grain size for the fine octree computed on the coarse grid procs
01593     //will be >= the true grain size and <= 8*(the true grain size) 
01594     //If P_coarse = P_fine, then the cost of the matvec goes up, but there is
01595     //no additional meshing and no scatters during transfers
01596     //If P_coarse < P_fine, then there is an extra fine grid mesh using P_fine
01597     //procs and extra scatters, but the cost of the matvec goes down (due to
01598     //smaller grain size)
01599 
01600     for(int i = (nlevels-2); i >= 0; i--) {
01601       if(maxProcsForThisLevel[i] > maxProcsForThisLevel[i+1]) {
01602         DendroIntL avgGrainSize = (globalOctreeSizeForThisLevel[i]/maxProcsForThisLevel[i]);
01603 
01604         DendroIntL avgGrainSizeUsing1LevCoarserNpes = 
01605           (globalOctreeSizeForThisLevel[i]/maxProcsForThisLevel[i+1]);
01606 
01607         if(static_cast<double>(avgGrainSizeUsing1LevCoarserNpes) <
01608             (1.5*static_cast<double>(avgGrainSize))) {
01609           maxProcsForThisLevel[i] = maxProcsForThisLevel[i+1];
01610         }
01611       } else {
01612         assert(maxProcsForThisLevel[i] == maxProcsForThisLevel[i+1]);
01613       }
01614     }//end for i
01615 
01616 #ifndef __SILENT_MODE__
01617     if(!rank) {
01618       std::cout<<" Using "<<nlevels<<" Multigrid Levels."<<std::endl; 
01619       fflush(stdout);
01620       for(int i = 0; i < nlevels; i++) {
01621         std::cout<<" maxNpes for lev "<< i <<": "<< maxProcsForThisLevel[i] <<std::endl;
01622         fflush(stdout);
01623       }
01624     }
01625 #endif
01626 
01627     PROF_SET_DA_STAGE3_END
01628 #ifdef __PROF_WITH_BARRIER__
01629       MPI_Barrier(comm);
01630 #endif
01631     PROF_SET_DA_STAGE4_BEGIN
01632 
01633       //Create activeComms for each level.
01634       //0 is the finest and (nlevels-1) is the coarsest
01635       MPI_Comm* activeComms = new MPI_Comm[nlevels];
01636     assert(activeComms);
01637 
01638     if(maxProcsForThisLevel[0] == npes) {
01639       activeComms[0] = comm;
01640     } else {
01641 #ifndef __SILENT_MODE__
01642       if(!rank) {
01643         std::cout<<"splitting Comm in SetDA (using comm) "<<npes<<" -> "<<maxProcsForThisLevel[0]<<std::endl; 
01644       }
01645 #endif
01646       par::splitCommUsingSplittingRank(maxProcsForThisLevel[0], activeComms, comm);
01647     }
01648     for(int lev = 1; lev < nlevels; lev++) {
01649       if(maxProcsForThisLevel[lev] == maxProcsForThisLevel[lev - 1]) {
01650         //coarse and fine grid use the same comm
01651         activeComms[lev] = activeComms[lev - 1];
01652       } else {
01653         assert(maxProcsForThisLevel[lev] < maxProcsForThisLevel[lev - 1]);
01654         if(maxProcsForThisLevel[lev] == activeNpesInCoarseBal[lev - 1]) {
01655           //The correct comm for this level was already created during coarsening
01656           activeComms[lev] = activeCommsInCoarseBal[lev - 1];
01657         } else if(maxProcsForThisLevel[lev] < activeNpesInCoarseBal[lev - 1]) {
01658           //The correct comm is a subset of the comm that was already created for this level
01659           if(maxProcsForThisLevel[lev - 1] < activeNpesInCoarseBal[lev - 1]) {
01660 #ifndef __SILENT_MODE__
01661             if(!rank) {
01662               std::cout<<"splitting Comm in SetDA (using fine activeComm) "<<
01663                 maxProcsForThisLevel[lev - 1]<<" -> "<<maxProcsForThisLevel[lev]<<std::endl; 
01664             }
01665 #endif
01666             if(rank < maxProcsForThisLevel[lev - 1]) {
01667               par::splitCommUsingSplittingRank(maxProcsForThisLevel[lev],
01668                   (activeComms + lev), activeComms[lev - 1]);
01669             }
01670           } else {
01671 #ifndef __SILENT_MODE__
01672             if(!rank) {
01673               std::cout<<"splitting Comm in SetDA (using coarseBalComm) "<<
01674                 activeNpesInCoarseBal[lev - 1]<<" -> "<<maxProcsForThisLevel[lev]<<std::endl; 
01675             }
01676 #endif
01677             if(rank < activeNpesInCoarseBal[lev - 1]) {
01678               par::splitCommUsingSplittingRank(maxProcsForThisLevel[lev],
01679                   (activeComms + lev), activeCommsInCoarseBal[lev - 1]);
01680             }
01681           }
01682         } else {
01683 #ifndef __SILENT_MODE__
01684           if(!rank) {
01685             std::cout<<"splitting Comm in SetDA (using fine activeComm) "<<
01686               maxProcsForThisLevel[lev - 1]<<" -> "<<maxProcsForThisLevel[lev]<<std::endl; 
01687           }
01688 #endif
01689           if(rank < maxProcsForThisLevel[lev - 1]) {
01690             par::splitCommUsingSplittingRank(maxProcsForThisLevel[lev],
01691                 (activeComms + lev), activeComms[lev - 1]);
01692           }
01693         }
01694       }
01695     }//end for lev
01696 
01697     PROF_SET_DA_STAGE4_END
01698 #ifdef __PROF_WITH_BARRIER__
01699       MPI_Barrier(comm);
01700 #endif
01701     PROF_SET_DA_STAGE5_BEGIN
01702 
01703       //Distribute the octrees on maxProcsForThisLevel processors
01704       //finestOctree is not empty on any processor and so all processors
01705       //participate in this scatter
01706       if(maxProcsForThisLevel[0] < npes) {
01707         std::vector<ot::TreeNode> tmpOctree;
01708         if(rank < maxProcsForThisLevel[0]) {
01709           DendroIntL avgGlobalOctSize = (globalOctreeSizeForThisLevel[0]/maxProcsForThisLevel[0]);
01710           int extraOcts = (globalOctreeSizeForThisLevel[0] % maxProcsForThisLevel[0]);
01711           if(rank < extraOcts) {
01712             par::scatterValues<ot::TreeNode>(finestOctree, tmpOctree,
01713                 (avgGlobalOctSize+1), comm);
01714           }else {
01715             par::scatterValues<ot::TreeNode>(finestOctree, tmpOctree,
01716                 avgGlobalOctSize, comm);
01717           }
01718         }else {
01719           par::scatterValues<ot::TreeNode>(finestOctree, tmpOctree,
01720               0, comm);
01721         }
01722         finestOctree = tmpOctree;
01723         tmpOctree.clear();
01724       }
01725 
01726     //coarseOctrees[i] is only distributed on activeCommsInCoarseBal[i]
01727     //It is empty on all other processors
01728     //So by using "activeCommsInCoarseBal[i]" instead of "comm", we can skip idle
01729     //processors from participating in the scatter. 
01730     //If "activeCommsInCoarseBal[i]" is different from "comm", it would have
01731     //been created using the function "splitCommUsingSplittingRank" inside
01732     //"CoarsenOctree" or "BalanceOctree". Moreover, this will happen only when
01733     //the the total input size for that function is < 1000*npes. When this
01734     //happens the input would be redistributed to the first few processors.
01735     //"splitCommUsingSplittingRank" preserves the relative order of ranks in
01736     //the old and new comms. Hence, on all active processors the "rank" in
01737     //"comm" and in "activeCommsInCoarseBal[i]" will be the same. Similarly,
01738     //"activeComms" is also created above using "splitCommUsingSplittingRank",
01739     //hence the ranks in "activeComms" and "comm" will also be the same. 
01740 
01741     for(int i = 1; i < nlevels; i++) {
01742       if(activeNpesInCoarseBal[i-1] < maxProcsForThisLevel[i]) {
01743         //This case happens when the grain size using activeNpes is more than
01744         //1.5 times the grain size using maxProcs 
01745         //We need to expand the communicator
01746         //Both active and inactive processors need to participate here
01747         //But not all inactive processors need to participate. We have already
01748         //created the final activeComms above. We can use that here
01749         std::vector<ot::TreeNode> tmpOctree;
01750         if(rank < maxProcsForThisLevel[i]) {
01751           DendroIntL avgGlobalOctSize = (globalOctreeSizeForThisLevel[i]/maxProcsForThisLevel[i]);
01752           int extraOcts = (globalOctreeSizeForThisLevel[i] % maxProcsForThisLevel[i]);
01753           if(rank < extraOcts) {
01754             par::scatterValues<ot::TreeNode>(coarserOctrees[i-1], tmpOctree,
01755                 (avgGlobalOctSize+1), activeComms[i]);
01756           }else {
01757             par::scatterValues<ot::TreeNode>(coarserOctrees[i-1], tmpOctree,
01758                 avgGlobalOctSize, activeComms[i]);
01759           }
01760         }
01761         coarserOctrees[i-1] = tmpOctree;
01762         tmpOctree.clear();
01763       } else if(activeNpesInCoarseBal[i-1] > maxProcsForThisLevel[i]) {
01764         //We need to shrink the communicator
01765         //This case happens when we decide to use the same number of processors
01766         //as the immediate coarser level or too many extra boundaries were
01767         //discarded resulting in new empty processors
01768         //Inactive processors can be skipped here
01769         if(activeStatesInCoarseBal[i-1]) {
01770           std::vector<ot::TreeNode> tmpOctree;
01771           if(rank < maxProcsForThisLevel[i]) {
01772             DendroIntL avgGlobalOctSize = (globalOctreeSizeForThisLevel[i]/maxProcsForThisLevel[i]);
01773             int extraOcts = (globalOctreeSizeForThisLevel[i] % maxProcsForThisLevel[i]);
01774             if(rank < extraOcts) {
01775               par::scatterValues<ot::TreeNode>(coarserOctrees[i-1], tmpOctree,
01776                   (avgGlobalOctSize+1), activeCommsInCoarseBal[i-1]);
01777             }else {
01778               par::scatterValues<ot::TreeNode>(coarserOctrees[i-1], tmpOctree,
01779                   avgGlobalOctSize, activeCommsInCoarseBal[i-1]);
01780             }
01781           }else {
01782             par::scatterValues<ot::TreeNode>(coarserOctrees[i-1], tmpOctree,
01783                 0, activeCommsInCoarseBal[i-1]);
01784           }
01785           coarserOctrees[i-1] = tmpOctree;
01786           tmpOctree.clear();
01787         }//end if active
01788       }//end if expanding or shrinking
01789     }//end for i
01790 
01791 #ifdef __USE_PVT_DA_IN_MG__
01792     //A simple implementation for now. This just calls flagNodesType3 for all
01793     //levels. A smarter implementation would use the fact that regular coarse
01794     //grid nodes remain regular on all finer octrees 
01795     ot::markHangingNodesAtAllLevels(finestOctree, nlevels, coarserOctrees,
01796         activeComms, dim, maxDepth);
01797 #endif
01798 
01799     if(activeStatesInCoarseBal) {
01800       delete [] activeStatesInCoarseBal;
01801       activeStatesInCoarseBal = NULL;
01802     }
01803 
01804     if(activeCommsInCoarseBal) {
01805       delete [] activeCommsInCoarseBal;
01806       activeCommsInCoarseBal = NULL;
01807     }
01808 
01809     if(activeNpesInCoarseBal) {
01810       delete [] activeNpesInCoarseBal;
01811       activeNpesInCoarseBal = NULL;
01812     }
01813 
01814     //nlevels has been corrected if necessary. Create the DAMG now...
01815     DAMG     *tmpDAMG = new DAMG[nlevels];  
01816     for (int i = 0; i < nlevels; i++) {
01817       tmpDAMG[i] = new _p_DAMG;    
01818       tmpDAMG[i]->nlevels  = nlevels - i;
01819       tmpDAMG[i]->totalLevels = nlevels;
01820       tmpDAMG[i]->comm     = comm;
01821       tmpDAMG[i]->user     = user;    
01822       tmpDAMG[i]->initialguess = NULL;
01823       tmpDAMG[i]->suppressedDOF = NULL; 
01824       tmpDAMG[i]->suppressedDOFaux = NULL; 
01825       tmpDAMG[i]->dof = dof;
01826       tmpDAMG[i]->da = NULL;
01827       tmpDAMG[i]->da_aux = NULL;
01828       tmpDAMG[i]->x = NULL;
01829       tmpDAMG[i]->b = NULL;
01830       tmpDAMG[i]->r = NULL;
01831       tmpDAMG[i]->J = NULL;
01832       tmpDAMG[i]->B = NULL;
01833       tmpDAMG[i]->R = NULL;
01834       tmpDAMG[i]->solve = NULL;         
01835       // KSP only 
01836       tmpDAMG[i]->ksp = NULL;             
01837       tmpDAMG[i]->rhs = NULL;
01838     }//end for i  
01839     *damg = tmpDAMG;
01840 
01841     PROF_SET_DA_STAGE5_END
01842 #ifdef __PROF_WITH_BARRIER__
01843       MPI_Barrier(comm);
01844 #endif
01845     PROF_SET_DA_STAGE6_BEGIN
01846 
01847       if(nlevels == 1) {
01848         //Single level only
01849 
01850 #ifndef __USE_PVT_DA_IN_MG__
01851         tmpDAMG[0]->da = new DA(finestOctree, comm, activeComms[0], compressLut, NULL, NULL);
01852 #else
01853         tmpDAMG[0]->da = new DA(1, finestOctree, comm, activeComms[0], compressLut, NULL, NULL);
01854 #endif
01855 
01856         if(!rank) {
01857           int activeNpes = tmpDAMG[0]->da->getNpesActive();
01858           if(activeNpes < npes) {
01859             std::cout<<"WARNING: Some processors will be"<<
01860               " idle even on the finest level."<<
01861               " You might want to use fewer processors."<<std::endl;
01862             fflush(stdout);
01863           }
01864         }
01865 
01866         finestOctree.clear();
01867 
01868         //Free memory
01869         delete [] maxProcsForThisLevel;
01870         maxProcsForThisLevel = NULL;
01871 
01872         delete [] globalOctreeSizeForThisLevel;
01873         globalOctreeSizeForThisLevel = NULL;
01874 
01875         delete [] activeComms;
01876         activeComms = NULL;
01877 
01878         //If initial nlevels was 1, then coarserOctree would never have been
01879         //created. If nlevels was reset to 1 later then coarserOctrees would
01880         //have been created.
01881         if(coarserOctrees != NULL) {
01882           delete [] coarserOctrees;
01883           coarserOctrees = NULL;
01884         }
01885 
01886         PROF_SET_DA_STAGE6_END
01887 
01888           ierr = DAMGSetUp(tmpDAMG);CHKERRQ(ierr); 
01889 
01890         PROF_MG_SET_DA_END
01891       }//special case: single grid  
01892 
01893     //Start with the coarsest octree and mesh. 
01894     std::vector<ot::TreeNode>* blocksPtr = NULL;
01895     ot::DA* newDa = NULL;
01896     while(idxOfCoarsestLev >= 0) {
01897 #ifdef __DEBUG_MG__
01898       MPI_Barrier(comm);
01899       if(!rank) {
01900         std::cout<<"Meshing 1st DA for lev: "<<idxOfCoarsestLev<<std::endl;
01901       }
01902       MPI_Barrier(comm);
01903 #endif
01904 
01905       if(newDa == NULL) {
01906 #ifndef __USE_PVT_DA_IN_MG__
01907         newDa = new DA(coarserOctrees[idxOfCoarsestLev], comm, 
01908             activeComms[idxOfCoarsestLev + 1], compressLut,
01909             blocksPtr, NULL);
01910 #else
01911         newDa = new DA(1, coarserOctrees[idxOfCoarsestLev], comm, 
01912             activeComms[idxOfCoarsestLev + 1], compressLut,
01913             blocksPtr, NULL);
01914 #endif
01915       }
01916 
01917       //The constructor will modify the input octree. So it's useless
01918       //afterwards.
01919       coarserOctrees[idxOfCoarsestLev].clear();
01920       tmpDAMG[nlevels-(2+idxOfCoarsestLev)]->da = newDa;
01921       newDa = NULL;
01922 
01923       bool procsNotUsedWell;
01924       if(!rank) {  
01925         int activeNpes = tmpDAMG[nlevels-(2+idxOfCoarsestLev)]->da->getNpesActive();
01926         if( (activeNpes < maxProcsForThisLevel[idxOfCoarsestLev+1]) ||
01927             (maxProcsForThisLevel[idxOfCoarsestLev+1] <
01928              maxProcsForThisLevel[idxOfCoarsestLev]) ) {
01929           procsNotUsedWell = true;
01930         } else {
01931           procsNotUsedWell = false;
01932         }
01933       }
01934 
01935       par::Mpi_Bcast<bool>(&procsNotUsedWell, 1, 0, comm);
01936 
01937       //For the mat-vecs, 
01938       //Communication cost: O(dependent)
01939       //Computation cost: O(own + pre-Ghost)
01940       //Heuristic: Give 75% weight to computation and 25% to communication
01941       //load =  0.75*computation + 0.25*communication  
01942       double minMaxLoad[2]; //0 for minLoad, 1 for maxLoad
01943 
01944       if(tmpDAMG[nlevels-(2+idxOfCoarsestLev)]->da->iAmActive()) {
01945         ot::DA* currDa = tmpDAMG[nlevels-(2+idxOfCoarsestLev)]->da;
01946 
01947         unsigned int localPreGhostSize = currDa->getIdxElementBegin();
01948 
01949         unsigned int localIndependentSize = currDa->getIndependentSize();
01950 
01951         unsigned int localOwnSize = currDa->getElementSize();
01952 
01953         unsigned int localDependentSize = (localOwnSize - localIndependentSize);
01954 
01955 #ifdef __NO_GHOST_LOOP__
01956         double computationLoad = localOwnSize;
01957 #else
01958         double computationLoad = (localOwnSize + localPreGhostSize);
01959 #endif
01960         double communicationLoad = localDependentSize;
01961 
01962         double localLoad = ((0.75*computationLoad) + (0.25*communicationLoad));
01963 
01964         par::Mpi_Reduce<double>(&localLoad, &(minMaxLoad[0]), 1, 
01965             MPI_MIN, 0, currDa->getCommActive());
01966 
01967         par::Mpi_Reduce<double>(&localLoad, &(minMaxLoad[1]), 1, 
01968             MPI_MAX, 0, currDa->getCommActive());
01969       }
01970 
01971       par::Mpi_Bcast<double>(minMaxLoad, 2, 0, comm);
01972 
01973       //Give the finer grids a chance to be well load balanced and
01974       //be distributed on as many procs as possible.
01975       bool needAuxGrid = (procsNotUsedWell ||
01976           (minMaxLoad[1] > (minMaxLoad[0]*loadFac)));
01977 
01978       //Get the coarse grid partition. This will be needed whether or not the
01979       //aux_mesh is required
01980       if(blocksPtr == NULL) {
01981         blocksPtr = new std::vector<ot::TreeNode>;
01982         (*blocksPtr) = tmpDAMG[nlevels-(2+idxOfCoarsestLev)]->da->getBlocks();
01983       }
01984 
01985       if(needAuxGrid) {
01986         //Need DA_AUX for the immediate finer octree
01987         //Create DA_AUX for the immediate finer octree using the current
01988         //partition
01989         //We don't want to alter the actual fine octree. So we work with a copy
01990         //instead.
01991         std::vector<ot::TreeNode> fineOctreeCopy;
01992         if(idxOfCoarsestLev > 0) {
01993           fineOctreeCopy = coarserOctrees[idxOfCoarsestLev-1];
01994         }else {
01995           fineOctreeCopy = finestOctree;
01996         }
01997 
01998         //Need to redistribute fineOctreeCopy such that the input is only
01999         //distributed on the processors that are active on the coarse grid.
02000         bool iAmActive = tmpDAMG[nlevels-(2+idxOfCoarsestLev)]->da->iAmActive();
02001         MPI_Comm newComm = tmpDAMG[nlevels-(2+idxOfCoarsestLev)]->da->getCommActive();
02002 
02003         DendroIntL mySize = fineOctreeCopy.size();
02004         DendroIntL totalSize = globalOctreeSizeForThisLevel[idxOfCoarsestLev];   
02005 
02006         std::vector<ot::TreeNode> fineOctAfterPart;
02007 
02008         if(rank < maxProcsForThisLevel[idxOfCoarsestLev]) {
02009           if(iAmActive) {
02010             int newRank;
02011             int newNpes;
02012             MPI_Comm_rank(newComm, &newRank);
02013             MPI_Comm_size(newComm, &newNpes);
02014             DendroIntL avgSize = (totalSize / newNpes);
02015             int leftOvers = (totalSize % newNpes);
02016             if(newRank < leftOvers) {
02017               par::scatterValues<ot::TreeNode>(fineOctreeCopy, fineOctAfterPart,
02018                   (avgSize+1), activeComms[idxOfCoarsestLev]);
02019             }else {
02020               par::scatterValues<ot::TreeNode>(fineOctreeCopy, fineOctAfterPart,
02021                   avgSize, activeComms[idxOfCoarsestLev]);
02022             }
02023           }else {
02024             par::scatterValues<ot::TreeNode>(fineOctreeCopy, fineOctAfterPart,
02025                 0, activeComms[idxOfCoarsestLev]);
02026           }//end if active on coarse grid
02027         }//end if active on fine grid
02028 
02029         fineOctreeCopy.clear();
02030 
02031 #ifdef __DEBUG_MG__
02032         MPI_Barrier(comm);
02033         if(!rank) {
02034           std::cout<<"Meshing 2nd DA for lev: "<<idxOfCoarsestLev<<std::endl;
02035         }
02036         MPI_Barrier(comm);
02037 #endif
02038 
02039         //This DA is aligned with the coarser grid
02040 #ifndef __USE_PVT_DA_IN_MG__
02041         newDa = new DA(fineOctAfterPart, comm, newComm, compressLut, blocksPtr, NULL);
02042 #else
02043         newDa = new DA(1, fineOctAfterPart, comm, newComm, compressLut, blocksPtr, NULL);
02044 #endif
02045 
02046         fineOctAfterPart.clear();
02047 
02048         //Re-calculate imbalance. Check if aux mesh was really necessary
02049         //a-priori estimates could be misleading at times...
02050 
02051         if(!procsNotUsedWell) {
02052           if(newDa->iAmActive()) {
02053             ot::DA* currDa = newDa;
02054 
02055             unsigned int localPreGhostSize = currDa->getIdxElementBegin();
02056 
02057             unsigned int localOwnSize = currDa->getElementSize();
02058 
02059             unsigned int localIndependentSize = currDa->getIndependentSize();
02060 
02061             unsigned int localDependentSize = (localOwnSize - localIndependentSize);
02062 
02063 #ifdef __NO_GHOST_LOOP__
02064             double computationLoad = localOwnSize;
02065 #else
02066             double computationLoad = (localOwnSize + localPreGhostSize);
02067 #endif
02068             double communicationLoad = localDependentSize;
02069 
02070             double localLoad = ((0.75*computationLoad) + (0.25*communicationLoad));
02071 
02072             par::Mpi_Reduce<double>(&localLoad, &minMaxLoad[0], 1, 
02073                 MPI_MIN, 0, currDa->getCommActive());
02074 
02075             par::Mpi_Reduce<double>(&localLoad, &minMaxLoad[1], 1, 
02076                 MPI_MAX, 0, currDa->getCommActive());
02077           }
02078 
02079           par::Mpi_Bcast<double>(minMaxLoad, 2, 0, comm);
02080 
02081           needAuxGrid = (minMaxLoad[1] > (minMaxLoad[0]*loadFac));
02082         } else {
02083           needAuxGrid = true;
02084         }
02085 
02086         if(needAuxGrid) {
02087           tmpDAMG[nlevels-(1+idxOfCoarsestLev)]->da_aux = newDa;
02088           newDa = NULL;
02089 
02090           //We don't want to use the same partition for the next finer level.
02091           blocksPtr->clear();
02092           delete blocksPtr;
02093           blocksPtr = NULL;
02094         }
02095       }//end check for aux_mesh 
02096 
02097       idxOfCoarsestLev--;
02098     }//end loop to mesh coarser grids
02099 
02100     //Free the memory for the pointers to the coarser octrees.
02101     delete [] coarserOctrees;
02102     coarserOctrees = NULL;
02103 
02104     delete [] globalOctreeSizeForThisLevel;
02105     globalOctreeSizeForThisLevel = NULL;
02106 
02107     delete [] maxProcsForThisLevel;
02108     maxProcsForThisLevel = NULL;
02109 
02110 #ifdef __DEBUG_MG__
02111     MPI_Barrier(comm);
02112     if(!rank) {
02113       std::cout<<"Meshing finest octree: "<<std::endl;
02114     }
02115     MPI_Barrier(comm);
02116 #endif
02117 
02118     //mesh finest level here
02119     if(newDa == NULL) {
02120 #ifndef __USE_PVT_DA_IN_MG__
02121       newDa = new DA(finestOctree, comm, activeComms[0], compressLut, blocksPtr, NULL);
02122 #else
02123       newDa = new DA(1, finestOctree, comm, activeComms[0], compressLut, blocksPtr, NULL);
02124 #endif
02125     }
02126 
02127 #ifdef __DEBUG_MG__
02128     MPI_Barrier(comm);
02129     if(!rank) {
02130       std::cout<<"Finished meshing finest octree: "<<std::endl;
02131     }
02132     MPI_Barrier(comm);
02133 #endif
02134 
02135     tmpDAMG[nlevels-1]->da = newDa;
02136     newDa = NULL;
02137 
02138     finestOctree.clear();
02139 
02140     delete [] activeComms;
02141     activeComms = NULL;
02142 
02143     if(!rank) {
02144       int activeNpes = tmpDAMG[nlevels-1]->da->getNpesActive();
02145       if(activeNpes < npes) {
02146         std::cout<<"WARNING: Some processors will be idle"
02147           <<" even on the finest level."
02148           <<" You might want to use fewer processors."<<std::endl;
02149         fflush(stdout);
02150       }
02151     }
02152 
02153     if(blocksPtr != NULL) {
02154       blocksPtr->clear();
02155       delete blocksPtr;
02156       blocksPtr = NULL;
02157     }
02158 
02159     PROF_SET_DA_STAGE6_END
02160 
02161       ierr = DAMGSetUp(tmpDAMG); CHKERRQ(ierr); 
02162 
02163     PROF_MG_SET_DA_END
02164 
02165   }//end fn.
02166 
02167   PetscErrorCode DAMGSetUp(DAMG* damg)
02168   {
02169     PROF_MG_SETUP_BEGIN
02170 
02171       int       i,nlevels = damg[0]->nlevels;
02172 
02173 
02174 #ifdef __DEBUG_MG__
02175     int rank;
02176     MPI_Comm_rank(damg[0]->comm,&rank);
02177     if(!rank) {
02178       std::cout<<"In DAMGSetUp."<<std::endl;
02179       fflush(stdout);
02180     }   
02181 #endif
02182 
02183     /* Create work vectors and matrix for each level */
02184     damg[0]->da->createVector(damg[0]->x, false, false, damg[0]->dof);
02185     VecDuplicate(damg[0]->x,&damg[0]->b); 
02186     VecDuplicate(damg[0]->x,&damg[0]->r); 
02187 
02188 #ifdef __DEBUG_MG__
02189     assert(damg[0]->da_aux == NULL);
02190 #endif
02191 
02192     for (i = 1; i < nlevels; i++) {
02193       damg[i]->da->createVector(damg[i]->x, false, false, damg[i]->dof);
02194       VecDuplicate(damg[i]->x,&damg[i]->b); 
02195       VecDuplicate(damg[i]->x,&damg[i]->r); 
02196 
02197       /* Create interpolation/restriction between levels. */  
02198       //nlevels must be atleast 2 for Restriction/Interpolation  
02199       //i is fine, i-1 is coarse
02200       if(damg[i]->da_aux == NULL) {
02201         //Type-1. Assume Coarse and Fine are aligned. Do not use aux.
02202 #ifdef __DEBUG_MG__
02203         if(!rank) {
02204           std::cout<<"Lev: "<<i<<" R-type: 1"<<std::endl;
02205           fflush(stdout);
02206         }
02207 #endif
02208         createInterpolationType1(damg[i-1],damg[i],&damg[i]->R); 
02209       }else {
02210         //Type-2. Use Aux. Coarse and Fine are not aligned.
02211 #ifdef __DEBUG_MG__
02212         if(!rank) {
02213           std::cout<<"Lev: "<<i<<" R-type: 2"<<std::endl;
02214           fflush(stdout);
02215         }
02216 #endif
02217         createInterpolationType2(damg[i-1],damg[i],&damg[i]->R); 
02218       }
02219     }//end for i
02220 
02221     PROF_MG_SETUP_END
02222   }
02223 
02224   /*Matrix-Free Intergrid Transfer Operators 
02225 Type1: Assume Coarse and Fine are aligned. Do not use aux.
02226 Type2: Use Aux. Coarse and Fine are not aligned.
02227 */
02228   PetscErrorCode createInterpolationType1(DAMG damgc, DAMG damgf, Mat *R)
02229   {
02230     PROF_MG_CREATE_RP1_BEGIN
02231 
02232       ot::DA*   dac = damgc->da; 
02233     ot::DA*   daf = damgf->da;  
02234     unsigned int dof = damgc->dof;
02235     MPI_Comm comm = damgc->comm;
02236     unsigned int  mc,mf;
02237     //The size this processor owns ( without ghosts).
02238     mc=dac->getNodeSize();
02239     mf=daf->getNodeSize();
02240     TransferOpData* data = new TransferOpData;
02241 
02242     unsigned int localCoarseIndSize =  dac->getIndependentSize();
02243 
02244     if(dac->iAmActive()) {
02245       par::Mpi_Allreduce<unsigned int>(&localCoarseIndSize, &(data->minIndependentSize), 1,
02246           MPI_MIN, dac->getCommActive());
02247     } else {
02248       data->minIndependentSize = 0;
02249     }
02250 
02251     data->dac = dac;
02252     data->daf = daf;
02253     data->suppressedDOFc = damgc->suppressedDOF;
02254     data->suppressedDOFf = damgf->suppressedDOF;
02255     data->comm = comm;
02256     data->dof = dof;
02257     data->fineTouchedFlags = new std::vector<ot::FineTouchedStatus>;
02258 
02259     data->tmp = NULL;
02260     data->addRtmp = NULL;
02261     data->addPtmp = NULL;
02262 
02263     data->sendSzP = NULL;
02264     data->sendOffP = NULL;
02265     data->recvSzP = NULL;
02266     data->recvOffP = NULL;
02267     data->sendSzR = NULL;
02268     data->sendOffR = NULL;
02269     data->recvSzR = NULL;
02270     data->recvOffR = NULL;
02271 
02272     iC(MatCreateShell(comm, mc*dof ,mf*dof,PETSC_DETERMINE,PETSC_DETERMINE, (void*)(data), R));  
02273     iC(MatShellSetOperation(*R,MATOP_MULT_TRANSPOSE,(void(*)(void))prolongMatVecType1));
02274     iC(MatShellSetOperation(*R,MATOP_MULT,(void(*)(void))restrictMatVecType1));
02275     iC(MatShellSetOperation(*R,MATOP_MULT_ADD,(void(*)(void))addRestrictMatVec));
02276     iC(MatShellSetOperation(*R,MATOP_MULT_TRANSPOSE_ADD,(void(*)(void))addProlongMatVec));
02277     iC(MatShellSetOperation(*R ,MATOP_DESTROY, (void(*)(void)) rpMatDestroy));
02278 
02279     //dummy call to restrict-type-1
02280     data->daf->createVector<ot::FineTouchedStatus >(*(data->fineTouchedFlags), false, false, 1);
02281     dummyRestrictMatVecType1(data);
02282 
02283     PROF_MG_CREATE_RP1_END
02284   }
02285 
02286   PetscErrorCode  createInterpolationType2(DAMG damgc, DAMG damgf, Mat *R)      
02287   {
02288     PROF_MG_CREATE_RP2_BEGIN
02289 
02290       ot::DA*   dac = damgc->da; 
02291     ot::DA*   daf = damgf->da;  
02292     ot::DA*  daf_aux = damgf->da_aux;
02293     unsigned int dof = damgc->dof;
02294     MPI_Comm comm = damgc->comm;
02295     unsigned int  mc,mf;
02296     //The size this processor owns ( without ghosts).
02297     mc=dac->getNodeSize();
02298     mf=daf->getNodeSize();
02299     TransferOpData* data = new TransferOpData;
02300 
02301     unsigned int localCoarseIndSize =  dac->getIndependentSize();
02302 
02303     if(dac->iAmActive()) {
02304       par::Mpi_Allreduce<unsigned int>(&localCoarseIndSize, &(data->minIndependentSize), 1,
02305           MPI_MIN, dac->getCommActive());
02306     } else {
02307       data->minIndependentSize = 0;
02308     }
02309 
02310     data->dac = dac;
02311     data->daf = daf_aux;        
02312     data->suppressedDOFc = damgc->suppressedDOF;
02313     data->suppressedDOFf = damgf->suppressedDOFaux;
02314     data->comm = comm;
02315     data->dof = dof;
02316     data->fineTouchedFlags = new std::vector<ot::FineTouchedStatus>;
02317     daf_aux->createVector(data->tmp, false, false, dof);
02318     data->addRtmp = NULL;
02319     data->addPtmp = NULL;
02320 
02321     data->sendSzP = NULL;
02322     data->sendOffP = NULL;
02323     data->recvSzP = NULL;
02324     data->recvOffP = NULL;
02325     data->sendSzR = NULL;
02326     data->sendOffR = NULL;
02327     data->recvSzR = NULL;
02328     data->recvOffR = NULL;
02329 
02330     iC(MatCreateShell(comm, mc*dof ,mf*dof,PETSC_DETERMINE,PETSC_DETERMINE, (void*)(data), R));  
02331     iC(MatShellSetOperation(*R,MATOP_MULT_TRANSPOSE,(void(*)(void))prolongMatVecType2));
02332     iC(MatShellSetOperation(*R,MATOP_MULT,(void(*)(void))restrictMatVecType2));
02333     iC(MatShellSetOperation(*R,MATOP_MULT_TRANSPOSE_ADD,(void(*)(void))addProlongMatVec));
02334     iC(MatShellSetOperation(*R,MATOP_MULT_ADD,(void(*)(void))addRestrictMatVec));
02335     iC(MatShellSetOperation(*R ,MATOP_DESTROY, (void(*)(void)) rpMatDestroy));
02336 
02337     //dummy call to restrict-type-1.
02338     //Note type2 is not called. Since we don't need to scatter values for the
02339     //dummy loop. In fact, it will be wrong to use scatter values since it will
02340     //create the scatter contexts the first time it is called.
02341     data->daf->createVector<ot::FineTouchedStatus >(*(data->fineTouchedFlags), false, false, 1);
02342     dummyRestrictMatVecType1(data);
02343 
02344     PROF_MG_CREATE_RP2_END
02345   }
02346 
02347   PetscErrorCode  rpMatDestroy(Mat R) {
02348     TransferOpData *data;
02349     PetscFunctionBegin;
02350     iC(MatShellGetContext( R, (void **)&data));
02351     if(data) {
02352       if(data->fineTouchedFlags) { 
02353         data->fineTouchedFlags->clear(); 
02354         delete data->fineTouchedFlags;
02355         data->fineTouchedFlags = NULL;
02356       }
02357       if(data->tmp) { 
02358         iC(VecDestroy(data->tmp));
02359         data->tmp = NULL;
02360       }  
02361       if(data->addRtmp) {
02362         VecDestroy(data->addRtmp);
02363         data->addRtmp = NULL;
02364       }
02365       if(data->addPtmp) {
02366         VecDestroy(data->addPtmp);
02367         data->addPtmp = NULL;
02368       }
02369       if(data->sendSzP) {
02370         delete [] data->sendSzP;
02371         data->sendSzP = NULL;
02372       }
02373       if(data->sendOffP) {
02374         delete [] data->sendOffP;
02375         data->sendOffP = NULL;
02376       }
02377       if(data->recvSzP) {
02378         delete [] data->recvSzP;
02379         data->recvSzP = NULL;
02380       }
02381       if(data->recvOffP) {
02382         delete [] data->recvOffP;
02383         data->recvOffP = NULL;
02384       }
02385       if(data->sendSzR) {
02386         delete [] data->sendSzR;
02387         data->sendSzR = NULL;
02388       }
02389       if(data->sendOffR) {
02390         delete [] data->sendOffR;
02391         data->sendOffR = NULL;
02392       }
02393       if(data->recvSzR) {
02394         delete [] data->recvSzR;
02395         data->recvSzR = NULL;
02396       }
02397       if(data->recvOffR) {
02398         delete [] data->recvOffR;
02399         data->recvOffR = NULL;
02400       }
02401       delete data;
02402       data = NULL;
02403     }
02404 
02405     PetscFunctionReturn(0);
02406   }
02407 
02408   void PrintDAMG(DAMG* damg) {
02409     int  nlevels = damg[0]->nlevels;
02410     int rank;
02411     MPI_Comm_rank(damg[0]->comm,&rank);
02412     for (int i = 0; i < nlevels; i++) {
02413       MPI_Comm activeComm = damg[i]->da->getCommActive();
02414       MPI_Comm activeAuxComm;
02415 
02416       if(damg[i]->da_aux) {
02417         activeAuxComm = damg[i]->da_aux->getCommActive();
02418       }
02419 
02420       DendroIntL globalBlocksSize;
